insights.title: Sharp drop in supplier count
insights.observation: Your active supplier base fell from 10 in your lifetime average to just 1 in the current 90‑day window (≈90% reduction).
insights.recommendation: Re‑engage previously used suppliers and qualify additional vendors to reduce concentration risk and improve negotiation leverage.

insights.title: Significant decline in unit price vs history
insights.observation: Average price per unit decreased from $4,495.60 historically to $2,621.44 now, a 41% drop.
insights.recommendation: Validate that the lower unit cost does not compromise product quality or specifications; consider locking in these favorable rates with longer contracts.

insights.title: Supplier count far below industry norm
insights.observation: Your current supplier count (1) is 73% lower than the industry average of 3.7 suppliers per period (below the 25th percentile).
insights.recommendation: Broaden your supplier pool to at least the industry median (≈3‑4 suppliers) to mitigate supply‑chain risk and enhance competitive pricing.

insights.title: Unit price advantage over peers
insights.observation: Your average price per unit ($2,621) is about 24% lower than the industry average ($3,455).
insights.recommendation: Leverage this cost advantage in negotiations with existing suppliers and document best‑practice pricing for future category benchmarks.

insights.title: High spend concentration despite lower spend per supplier
insights.observation: Spend per supplier is $13.5 M, 24% lower than the industry average spend per supplier ($17.8 M), yet you rely on a single supplier (1 vs 3.7 industry average).
insights.recommendation: Diversify spend across multiple suppliers to balance risk while preserving the cost benefit; target at least two additional suppliers in high‑spend categories.

insights.title: Spend up, quantity down – potential missed volume discounts
insights.observation: Current period spend rose 12.5% versus the previous period while purchase quantity fell 20.3%, shifting spend toward higher‑value items. Industry quantity averages 19,097 units, far above your 5,160 units.
insights.recommendation: Analyze the product mix to identify opportunities for bulk purchasing or consolidating low‑value items, aiming to increase order volume and capture volume‑based discounts.
